meanings.definition: The act or process of freezing or solidifying.
meanings.sent1: The congelation of the ice cream made it too hard to scoop.
meanings.sent2: The congelation of the lake turned it into a solid sheet of ice.
meanings.sent3: The congelation of the juice in the freezer created a fruity ice pop.
meanings.sent4: The congelation of fear in his heart paralyzed him with dread.
meanings.sent5: The congelation of the chocolate syrup on the ice cream formed a delicious shell.

meanings.definition: The state of being frozen or solidified.
meanings.sent1: The congelation of the river prevented the boats from moving.
meanings.sent2: The congelation of the meat kept it fresh in the freezer.
meanings.sent3: The congelation of the pudding in the fridge made it a solid block.
meanings.sent4: The congelation of time seemed to stop in the icy landscape.
meanings.sent5: The congelation of the lava turned it into a hardened rock formation.
